alert.note: Alert for Ketchikan Gateway Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 11:38PM AKST until December 24 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR PARTS OF SE AK THROUGH CHRISTMAS... Multiple frontal bands will pass over the panhandle through the weekend bringing periods of snow. A band of snow is moving through the north this evening. Reports of light to moderate snow have been coming in so far. A range of snowfall reports from the northern panhandle have been from 1 to 14 inches. Reports from the southern panhandle have been from 3 to 8 inches of snow with more expected before becoming a wintry mix, or all rain, by morning. A break, or at least a decrease in snowfall rates is occurring overnight across south, and the break remains on track for the morning hours over the north as a second frontal band tracks into the southern panhandle early Saturday. This front will move north into the northern areas by Saturday afternoon. This front will bring another round of snow and a chance of freezing rain for the central inner channels with the south changing to all rain through Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected and light freezing rain possible. Storm total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches. * WHERE...Ketchikan Gateway Borough. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Possible power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will begin to decrease Friday evening, then increase again early Saturday morning. A period of light freezing rain is possible late Friday night into Saturday before a change over to all rain.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
